reviewText:
I got this set today and was surprised by how light it was.  I thought there would be three Blu-Ray cases.  But, unfortunately the company that released them decided to have the type of set in which the discs just lay there on the sleeves.  They were all fine, but I took them out and put them in Blu-Ray cases so I could be sure they would not be damaged by the package.  The case that holds the discs is very solid and seems well built though.  The case is in a sleeve and you slide it from the top or bottom to get the case out and then the Blu-Rays are inside.  It looks very under cover and cool.  The figure seems very well made and will look very cool sitting in whatever place I decide to stick it.  Each blu ray is packed with special features.  Things like photo galleries, behind the scenes, blooper reel, games and commentary.  I always watch all the special features, so this is a great thing for me and those who do so as well.

I easily downloaded the digital copy for each.  Well, I have had problems with actually getting the movies from Sony.  The Sony Media manager is not showing up on my Windows 8 PC.  But that has nothing to do with the movies, or the fact that they were easily put into my movies list on Ultraviolet.  I just have to figure out how to download them. All and all I think this is a very cool set that any fans of the movie should own.  I got it for less than $60 which is a great price.

While I gave this set a 5 because of the great movies, the sturdy packing and all the great special features, I would give the way the Blu-Rays are in the case a 1.  Just put the discs in the standard cases.  They may cost more, but I would rather pay more and have safe discs than pay less and have to worry.
Watched the MIB movies from back when i was a kid back in 97.  Great movies and the 3rd really brought an understanding to the deep relationship that K and J had.

Caveat Emptor: Although the product description states that this plays in regions A(1), B(2), and C(3), the last movie only plays in region B(2) and C(3).  That means North American blu ray players will not be able to play MIB III.  This is a huge disappointment to me and I will try to return the item.

This great sci-fi/comedy trilogy features Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones in all three films. You get 3 movies on 3 discs along with UV digital copies: Men in Black, Men in Black 2, and Men in Black 3. A Limited Edition Worm Figurine is included. Overall, the picture and audio quality are very good (but a remastering wouldn't hurt on the first two films). There is over 3.5 hours of total bonus content plus 3 audio commentaries. The longest featurette is Partners in Time: The Making of 'MIB 3' (HD, 26 min). The 3D version of Men in Black 3 is not included (the 3D version also includes a couple more supplements). My only complaints are that I would have preferred a 3-hour retrospective documentary on the trilogy, the supplements on the original MiB could be beefed up, and MiB 2 weighs the trilogy down. Fans may want to purchase the films in their stand-alone Blu-rays for half the price since the worm figurine does not justify the price hike (although it is well made for a toy pack-in). These are 4 star films in a 3 star package.

Video Resolution/Codec: 1080p/AVC MPEG-4 | Aspect Ratio: 1.85:1
Audio Formats: English DolbyTrueHD 5.1, English DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1
Subtitles/Captions: English, English SDH, French, Spanish

Special Features:
[Men in Black] 2 Audio Commentaries + 35 minutes of bonus content.
[Men in Black 2] Audio Commentary + 105 minutes of bonus content.
[Men in Black 3] 90 minutes of bonus content.

Love these movies so it was a no brainer to buy the box set.  They come as 3 seperate Blu-Ray cases in a nice holder and they are exactly what you would expect in a Blu-Ray product.  Was a little disappointed that only 1 of the 3 movies came with a digital copy but it's becoming more difficult to find those in a single format these days with iTunes, VUDU, Flixster, etc.  A surprisingly sturdy and well-made figurine of one of the worms comes with this set as well.  And for those of you with kids who are wondering, the worm is only holding his signature cup of coffee, no cigarette.  While the figurine was pretty cute, it's not something I would personally keep so it's going in our next garage sale.

All in all - this was a nice set for the money and you can't beat the trilogy with J and K!

The movies pay great, the collector box will look great if we decide to display it that way, and the bobble figure is a great addition for the avid MIB fan.

I just received this yesterday, and I must say it was unique. The MIBIII disc alone, at a local electronics store, was almost $30.00, and for about $10.00 more, you get all three movies, and this very nice, well made Worm Figurine. This thing weighs about two pounds. I have only watched the MIBIII disc, but I liked it very much. If you are a fan of the MIB movie series, then this is the one to get.
I have 1 and 2 in standard dvd, already. Now I have all three in Blu-Ray. These are SO Much better in HD.
What else can I say. It is the MEN IN BLACK TRILOGY. They are all stellar movies, The ALIEN BOBBLE HEAD like figure is pretty cool too.
I was really surprised 3 Blu rays and a bobble head that is really cool. The price was not bad either. Delivered to my door with no sales tax. What more could you ask for.

Like many others I don't think Ultraviolet is a true digital copy. Getting these movies onto your computer is a giant, time-consuming hassle.

It is much better to have a digital copy, come on a physical disk.

I would have much preferred to buy this set that included Blu-ray, standard DVDs, and a digital copy on disk, and not received the toy!

I like the movies themselves fine.

This review is for the entire shopping experience and the physical item shipped by Amazon.  If you are after a "pure" movie review I recommend you also see the The Internet Movie Database.

love the statue, very sturdy--love the movies all of them. the first was the best obviously but the other 2 weren't far behind, hard to find anything wrong with these sequels and thats saying alot

The original MIB is one of my favorite movies.  The BluRay transfer is great heare and is, alone, well worth the purchase.  The quality is the same for the other two entries in the box but 1 and 3 are the only ones I'd consider worthwile films.  All three are packaged in a very nice booklet similar to the original MIB collectors edition DVD.  The extras, to my knowledge, are the same that are included with the individual BluRay transfers.  The "bobble head" figure is a fantastic addition for those that are into displaying that kind of thing.  It's heavy, doesn't feel like it would break easily, and has great detail.

I had been eyeing this on Amazon for several weeks but worried my wife would not agree to putting out the money for this, and anyway she's not much of a Men in Black fan like I am.  I happened to be at a store a couple of days after MIB 3's release and saw this there too & happened to have credit at this place so I picked it up.  (Nothing personal Amazon...I do purchase plenty on here though).

The collectible that comes in this collector's set is really rather cool...I set it on our TV stand right next to our TV, upon my wife's approval of course.  She may not be a big fan of Men In Black but she does like some of the aliens and stuff in it, LoL.

The trilogy comes in a collectible case with a dust cover, and I think it's pretty cool.  I did see ads at some places that 3 was suppose to have a DVD copy but never found one in it.  However, I'm not going to rate the product lower because the product itself doesn't say there is a DVD copy...just some various sites got it wrong.

As for the movies, 1 is and will always be my favorite...I remember watching that movie when it came out and I've loved it ever since.  After having watched 3, which I hadn't actually gotten a chance to see sadly until I bought this set, it officially became my 2nd favorite...I figured I'd like it after all the reviews I'd seen for it, and my dad & some friends told me it was pretty good, so I figured it was a safe bet.  2 is my 3rd favorite...good, but just not quite up to par with 3, and certainly not with 1.  Here is my individual ratings for each film:

Men in Black 5/5
Men in Black 2: 3.5/5
Men in Black 3: 4.5/5

So here's the scoop:  If you have never seen a single Men in Black film in your life, what's wrong with you?  If you have seen say 1 but not the others, I still recommend seeing them but 1 is the best, 3 is pretty good, and 2 is just good/not bad.  I for one really enjoy the whole series of movies, and this was certainly the perfect collector's set to add to my collection!

For those of us who grew up with Men in Black, this set is a wonderful dose of nostalgia. Although most will probably ignore the universally disliked MiB2, the first and third movies alone make this set worth purchasing. The first movie is a classic, and the third does an excellent job of tying up loose ends and further exploring the deep relationship between our two favorite agents. While the discs could have been packaged more securely, it isn't a big problem and it surely helps to keep the cost down a bit.

The worm figurine is probably not the primary reason most shoppers will buy this gift set, but it's pretty well made and it's certainly a conversation piece. For those who haven't seen the movies, this would be a great introduction to the trilogy. It's even worth slogging through the second movie. Despite the somewhat average reviews of the third movie, it stands very well on its own and is even better when taken in the context of the previous movies. This box set would certainly make a perfect gift for the holidays as well, whether for someone else or for yourself!
